case_circumstances: The subject was found lying on the sidewalk near the Ferry Building by a passerby who then called emergency services.  When paramedics arrived the subject was alert and told them that his last name was "Watanabe."  The subject then had a seizure and coded.  After the seizure he developed ventricular fibrillation and lost his pulse.  A king tube was placed and he was rushed to St. Francis Hospital where CPR continued until his pulse was regained.  Shortly after, however, the subject's heart rate slowed and despite efforts, he expired.
case_head_hair: Straight hair about 4 inches in length with moderate amounts of gray and vertex balding.
case_facial_hair: A mustache and beard are present and are of a dark/gray color.
case_clothing_with_body: Beige hat; beige raincoat; and red jacket
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
